name: Ryze
title: the Rune Mage
lore: Widely considered one of the most adept sorcerers on Runeterra, Ryze is an ancient, hard-bitten archmage with an impossibly heavy burden to bear. Armed with immense arcane power and a boundless constitution, he tirelessly hunts for World Runes—fragments of the raw magic that once shaped the world from nothingness. He must retrieve these artifacts before they fall into the wrong hands, for Ryze understands the horrors they could unleash on Runeterra.
blurb: Widely considered one of the most adept sorcerers on Runeterra, Ryze is an ancient, hard-bitten archmage with an impossibly heavy burden to bear. Armed with immense arcane power and a boundless constitution, he tirelessly hunts for World Runes—fragments...
allytips: Use Overload's passive to optimize for maximum damage or maximum speed.
Spell Flux's short cooldown allows it to be used to spread Flux to many enemies.
Ryze can move and cast other spells while Realm Warp is charging without cancelling the portal.
enemytips: Ryze is especially dangerous to opponents that are marked with Flux.
Use Realm Warp's windup time to figure out how to deal with what may be coming out of the portal.
Crowd controlling Ryze during Realm Warp's windup will cancel the portal.

riot_spells.name: Overload
riot_spells.description:
Passively, Ryze's other basic abilities reset the cooldown of Overload and charge a rune. When Ryze casts Overload with 2 runes charged, he gains a brief burst of Movement Speed.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If the target has Flux on it, Overload deals extra damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Passive: Rune Prison and Spell Flux reset Overload's cooldown and charge a rune (up to {{ maximumrunes }}) for {{ runeduration }} seconds. Overload discharges all runes, granting {{ movementspeedamount }}% Movement Speed for {{ movementspeedduration }} seconds if {{ maximumrunes }} runes are charged.

Active: Unleash a blast that deals {{ qdamagecalc }} magic damage to the first enemy struck. If the target has Flux on it, Overload consumes it, dealing {{ spell.ryzer:overloaddamagebonus }}% increased damage and bouncing to nearby enemies with Flux.

riot_spells.name: Rune Prison
riot_spells.description: Ryze traps a target in a cage of runes, damaging them and slowing their movement. If the target has Flux on it, they are instead rooted.
riot_spells.tooltip: Instantly deal {{ wdamagecalc }} magic damage and slow an enemy by {{ slowamount*100 }}% for {{ ccduration }} seconds. If the target has <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> on it, it is rooted instead, consuming <keywordMajor>Flux</keywordMajor> in the process.

riot_spells.name: Spell Flux
riot_spells.description: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs all nearby enemies. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Fire an orb that deals {{ edamagecalc }} magic damage, spreading Flux to the target and all nearby enemies for {{ debuffduration }} seconds.

If attempting to apply Flux to an enemy that already has it, it further spreads.

riot_spells.name: Realm Warp
riot_spells.description:
Passively, Overload deals even more damage against targets with Flux.

On cast, Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Passive: Overload damage bonus against targets with Flux increased to {{ overloaddamagebonus }}%.

Active: Ryze opens a portal to another location. After {{ chargetimetooltip }} seconds, all allies near the portal are teleported to that location.

If Ryze becomes unable to cast or move, Realm Warp is cancelled.

riot_passive.name: Arcane Mastery
riot_passive.description: <mainText>Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.</mainText>

i1.name: Arcane Mastery
i1.blurb: Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.

q1.name: Overload
q1.blurb: Passively, Ryze's other damaging spells reset Overload and begin to charge a Rune that can be used to empower Overload. On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If a Rune is fully charged, Ryze also gains Movement Speed.
q1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Ryze's''' other basic abilities reset {{sti|cdr|''Overload's'' cooldown}} and charge a {{ai|Overload 3||Rune}} for 4 seconds, up to 2.
q1.description2: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' unleashes a runic blast in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first enemy struck and consuming all of his {{ai|Overload 2||Runes}}.
q1.description3: If '''Ryze''' consumes 2 Runes, he gains {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for 2 seconds.
q1.description4: {{sbc|{{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux:}}}} ''Overload'' deals {{pp|type=[[File:Realm Warp.png|20px|border]] Realm Warp's rank|4|key=%|10 to 100|0 to 3}} increased damage, and spreads to all nearby enemies marked with ''Flux''.
q1.notes:
* Applies {{tip|multi-hit}} spell effects to nearby enemies affected by {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux}}.
* Killing an enemy, marked with {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux}}, with ''Overload'' will only apply {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze}} to nearby enemies, and not ''Overload's'' damage.

w1.name: Rune Prison
w1.blurb: Ryze traps a target enemy unit in a cage of runes, damaging them and preventing them from moving.
w1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' instantly deals {{as|magic damage}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} the target enemy by 35% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
w1.description2: {{sbc|{{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze|Flux:}}}} ''Rune Prison's'' {{tip|slow}} is converted to a {{tip|root}} for the same duration.

e1.name: Spell Flux
e1.blurb: Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs them. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.
e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' hurls an orb of runic energy at the target enemy, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to his target and marking them and nearby enemies with ''Flux'' for 3 seconds, causing his next basic ability against them to consume the mark and gain bonus effects.
e1.notes:
* ''Spell Flux's'' second cast on a target will apply a new ''Flux'' debuff as well as triggering the previous one (effectively refreshing the duration).
* Applies {{tip|multi-hit}} spell effects to nearby enemies when spreading ''Flux'' to nearby enemies.

r1.name: Realm Warp
r1.blurb: Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.
r1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} Increases {{ais|Overload|Ryze}} damage against targets marked with {{ai|Spell Flux|Ryze}}.
r1.description2: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ryze''' opens a portal on the ground at his current location and begins {{ct|channel|channeling|attack=true|move=true|cast=true|items=true,,interrupts|spells=true|interrupts=silence,root,revival-false}}. If '''Ryze''' successfully channels for 2 seconds, all allied units within the portal {{tip|blink}} to the target location and very briefly become {{tip|untargetable}}. ''Realm Warp'' can affect untargetable allies.
r1.notes:
* ''Realm Warp'' casts at maximum range if attempting to cast beyond it.
* ''Realm Warp'' will try to predict whether an ally is trying to run out of it or not and will not teleport allies that are very near the edge and move click outside of it.
* {{tip|Untargetable}} effect lasts approximately {{fd|0.75}} seconds.
* Teleported units retain the same relative positions to one another upon arrival.
* '''Ryze''' will not teleport if he exits the area, but the teleport will still occur for other allies so long as Ryze isn't interrupted.
* {{tip|Ground}} will both prevent '''Ryze''' from activating, as well as prevent units from being teleported, but will not interrupt the channel.
* Allied {{tip|stasis}} effects will '''not''' interrupt ''Realm Warp's'' channel - excluding {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} and {{ii|Stopwatch}} - like the passive of {{ii|Guardian Angel}} or an allied {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}}. Other allies untargetable by similar effects will also be teleported.
** A hostile {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}} will interrupt the channel.
* ''Realm Warp's'' interaction with channelled abilities seems to be case-by-case:
** The following channels will prevent the caster from being teleported: {{si|Teleport}}, {{si|Recall}} and {{ai|Ace in the Hole|Caitlyn}}. They will not, however, interrupt the channel (e.g. if Ryze uses Teleport).
** The following channels do not prevent you getting teleported and are '''not''' interrupted: {{ai|Crowstorm|Fiddlesticks}}{{tt|*|When Fiddlesticks' channel resolves, he will blink the full distance to his own target location regardless of how far away Ryze has taken him.}}, {{ai|Requiem|Karthus}} and {{ai|Absolute Zero|Nunu}}.
** ''These lists are not complete.''
* Ryze can teleport {{ci|Zac}} during his {{ai|Cell Division}}, moving both his ''blobbies'' as well as the point where they are attempting to converge.
